verses.verse: (1 He prayeth to be right speedily delivered.2 He desireth the shame of his enemies,4 And the joyful comfort of all those that seek the Lord. O (Cross references: : Ps. 40:13) God, (He teacheth us to be earnest in prayer, though God seem to stay: for at his time he will hear us.) haste thee to deliver me: make haste to help me, O Lord.

Let them be (He was assured that the more they raged, the nearer they were to destruction, and he the nearer to his deliverance.) confounded and put to shame, that seek my soul: let them be turned backward and put to rebuke, that desire mine hurt.
Let them be turned back for a reward of their (Hereby we are taught not to mock at others in their misery, lest the same fall on our own necks.) shame, which say, Aha, aha.
But let all those that seek thee, be joyful and glad in thee, and let all that love thy salvation, say always, God be praised.

Now I am (Because he had felt Godâ€™s help before, he groundeth on experience, and boldly seeketh unto him for succor.) poor and needy: O God, make haste to me: thou art my helper, and my deliverer: O Lord, make no tarrying.
